availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1859-1862

body.p:
Herald Extra
PADUCAH, KY., MAY 31, 1861.
Friday Morning, 9 o'clock.
Latest Dispatches.
Military School.

A gentleman by the name of Austin, from Arkansas, announced on yesterday, at Mayfield, that he was moving to Columbus, Ky., for the purpose of establishing a Military School, and that his baggage consisted of eight 32-pounders and a car load of small arms, Irish buggies, &c. He invited all the young men of the Purchase to attend his institution. He also announced that if there was a Lincolnite present, he desired him to go with all haste to Cairo and inform Gen. Prentiss of the fact, for if he did not go quick, Frentiss would not be able to take his baggage.
We wish this Institution the greatest success.
